3967650992,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/experienced-%E2%80%93-data-scientist-ai-%E2%80%93-roma-milano-%E2%80%93-risk-advisory-at-deloitte-3967650992?position=6&pageNum=2&refId=ZuEMm%2BF%2FQVsgCXm6CsR1Sg%3D%3D&trackingId=bt4%2FEcJ0BvSVpAPGEc%2F5HA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Experienced – Data Scientist AI – Roma/Milano – Risk Advisory,Deloitte,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Stiamo cercando una figura Consultant/Senior Consultant da inserire nel team Digital Controls CPP di Deloitte Risk Advisory per le sedi di Roma e Milano che lavorerà in modalità Hybrid.

Il business Digital Controls CPP si occupa di fornire servizi di Digital Transformation, che hanno l’obiettivo di supportare la digitalizzazione dei processi interni di business, mettendo in atto attività che prevedono l’utilizzo di strumenti di Data Analytics, Machine Learning, IoT e AI sfruttando i principali servizi messi a disposizione dai più importanti player del settore Cloud.
La risorsa Experienced verrà inserita in un team di lavoro e si occuperà di:
Supervisionare, coordinare e gestire, come Team Leader, un team di sviluppo o consulenti junior
Progettare ed analizzare soluzioni IT complesse sia di tipo applicativo che di integrazione
Gestire autonomamente troubleshooting articolati e sotto pressione
Lavorare in team numerosi dislocati anche su scala internazionale.
Esperienza nella gestione end-to-end di progetti di Data Science: disegno, sviluppo e test di soluzioni AI
Ottima conoscenza di Python e delle librerie per manipolazione dati e sviluppo modelli (Pandas, TensorFlow, Scikit-learn, PyTorch, ecc.)
Esperienza con tecnologie di Generative AI e modelli LLM
Esperienza con strumenti di containerizzazione (e.g. docker)
Conoscenza di strumenti e linguaggi per la manipolazione dei dati: SQL, MongoDB, Neo4j, Spark, ecc.

Deloitte è un network leader nei servizi professionali alle imprese, presente in oltre 150 Paesi con 457 mila professionisti. Offriamo soluzioni innovative e sostenibili in Audit & Assurance, Consulting, Financial Advisory, Risk Advisory, Tax e Legal. Il nostro obiettivo è supportare le aziende nello sviluppo e nell'implementazione di strategie al passo con il mercato.

In Deloitte la sostenibilità è un tema centrale. Per questo, attraverso le strategie e le progettualità legate alle tematiche Environmental, Social e Governance (ESG), ci impegniamo a promuovere una crescita responsabile, sostenibile e inclusiva per il Pianeta, le nostre persone e la società. Scopri di più sulle nostre strategie di Corporate Sustainability, tra cui Well-being, la strategia volta a migliorare il benessere fisico, mentale e sociale delle nostre persone, affinché siano felici e piene di energia in tutti gli ambiti della loro vita e WorldClimate, la strategia globale di Deloitte per diventare un’organizzazione Net Zero e per guidare scelte responsabili all’interno e all’esterno dell’organizzazione.
Sei pront* a #MakeAnImpactThatMatter insieme? Candidati ora!

Le persone interessate possono inviare la propria candidatura con autorizzazione ai sensi del dlgs. 196/2003. La ricerca rispetta il d.lgs. 198/2006, il D.lgs. 215/03 e il D.lgs. 216/03 ed è aperta a candidat* di qualsiasi orientamento o espressione di genere, orientamento sessuale, età, etnia e credo religioso. Il presente annuncio è stato ideato nel rispetto della diversity e dell’inclusività.

4025317035,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/graph-data-scientist-rif-2024-05-at-aizoon-technology-consulting-4025317035?position=7&pageNum=2&refId=ZuEMm%2BF%2FQVsgCXm6CsR1Sg%3D%3D&trackingId=QWNjU4nP3%2BeGZk44M1EPeg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Graph Data Scientist (Rif. 2024-05),aizoOn Technology Consulting,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Join our Cybersecurity Team as a Graph Data Scientist!

At aizoOn, we have been pioneering cybersecurity solutions since 2007 and developing cutting-edge technology since 2012. Our flagship product, introduced in 2013, was among the first in the world to apply machine learning techniques to network traffic analysis, detecting behavioral anomalies and advanced attacks.

We are on a mission to transform cybersecurity challenges with a data driven approach. Our goal is to become a global vendor, with a disruptive platform to reshape the cybersecurity landscape. Traditional practices driven by risks hypothesis based on annual interviews and on-paper assessments are outdated. With our ESRA platform (Enhanced Security Risk Analytics), we provide near real-time visibility across the cyber realm and data-driven risk analysis, offering a revolutionary approach to objective cybersecurity risk management.
Innovative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team of over 30 experts with deep and diverse expertise, pushing the boundaries of cybersecurity.
Startup Spirit: We value entrepreneurial drive, innovative thinking, and the grit to challenge the status quo.
Passion for Technology: If you are passionate about technology and improving society, this is the place for you.
Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive salary, performance-based bonuses, welfare incentives and stock options.

As a Graph Data Scientist, you will be crucial in developing, evolving and maintaining our innovative cybersecurity solution, ESRA. Your contribution will directly impact the safety and security of our digital world.
Proposing new approaches to analyze and solve problems
Designing advanced algorithms on graphs modeling networks and medium/large environments (from thousands to hundreds of thousands of nodes)
Implementing proof-of-concept algorithms designed to validate their effectiveness and performance
Research activities for continuous improvement and innovation of the product
Education: Degree in technical-scientific disciplines (Plus: Ph.D. with topics related to graph analytics and algorithms).
Experience: at least 3 years of previous experience with algorithms and graph analytics (preferred on Big Data).
Language Skills: Proficiency in the English language.
Proficiency in tools for managing large graphs
Ability to design and implement algorithms and analytics, even on large graphs
Good programming skills in high-level languages
Plus: Experience in programming languages such as Python and Java
Cybersecurity: Previous experience cybersecurity context will be considered a plus
Join us in reshaping the cybersecurity landscape. Send your application and become a part of our innovation journey.

Join our Cybersecurity Team as a Graph Data Scientist!


At aizoOn, we have been pioneering cybersecurity solutions since 2007 and developing cutting-edge technology since 2012. Our flagship product, introduced in 2013, was among the first in the world to apply machine learning techniques to network traffic analysis, detecting behavioral anomalies and advanced attacks.


Our mission: Revolutionizing Cybersecurity

We are on a mission to transform cybersecurity challenges with a data driven approach. Our goal is to become a global vendor, with a disruptive platform to reshape the cybersecurity landscape. Traditional practices driven by risks hypothesis based on annual interviews and on-paper assessments are outdated. With our ESRA platform (Enhanced Security Risk Analytics), we provide near real-time visibility across the cyber realm and data-driven risk analysis, offering a revolutionary approach to objective cybersecurity risk management.


Why Join Us?

  • Innovative Environment: Be part of a dynamic team of over 30 experts with deep and diverse expertise, pushing the boundaries of cybersecurity.
  • Startup Spirit: We value entrepreneurial drive, innovative thinking, and the grit to challenge the status quo.
  • Passion for Technology: If you are passionate about technology and improving society, this is the place for you.
  • Comprehensive Benefits: Competitive salary, performance-based bonuses, welfare incentives and stock options.


Your Role

As a Graph Data Scientist, you will be crucial in developing, evolving and maintaining our innovative cybersecurity solution, ESRA. Your contribution will directly impact the safety and security of our digital world.

You will be responsible for:

  1. Proposing new approaches to analyze and solve problems
  2. Designing advanced algorithms on graphs modeling networks and medium/large environments (from thousands to hundreds of thousands of nodes)
  3. Implementing proof-of-concept algorithms designed to validate their effectiveness and performance
  4. Research activities for continuous improvement and innovation of the product


What We’re Looking For

  • Education: Degree in technical-scientific disciplines (Plus: Ph.D. with topics related to graph analytics and algorithms).
  • Experience: at least 3 years of previous experience with algorithms and graph analytics (preferred on Big Data).
  • Language Skills: Proficiency in the English language.


Technical Skills

  • Graph Drawing
  • Proficiency in tools for managing large graphs
  • Ability to design and implement algorithms and analytics, even on large graphs
  • Good programming skills in high-level languages
  • Plus: Experience in programming languages such as Python and Java
  • Cybersecurity: Previous experience cybersecurity context will be considered a plus


Apply Now!

Join us in reshaping the cybersecurity landscape. Send your application and become a part of our innovation journey.

4023887117,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/junior-business-developer-at-ferrovie-dello-stato-italiane-s-p-a-4023887117?position=8&pageNum=2&refId=ZuEMm%2BF%2FQVsgCXm6CsR1Sg%3D%3D&trackingId=mmrz9VtNKkFcHt1TcTHfNA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Junior business developer,Ferrovie dello Stato Italiane S.p.A.,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Sei alla ricerca di un'azienda con una solida tradizione alle spalle e lo sguardo rivolto al futuro? Vorresti far parte di uno dei più grandi gruppi industriali italiani contribuendo allo sviluppo e alla transizione sostenibile del nostro Paese?

Siamo RFI, Rete Ferroviaria Italiana S.p.A. , la società del Gruppo Ferrovie dello Stato Italiane che si occupa della gestione dell'Infrastruttura Ferroviaria Nazionale. La nostra missione è assicurare la connessione tra le diverse aree del Paese, gestendo in sicurezza ed efficienza la circolazione e le infrastrutture ferroviarie e siamo alla ricerca di persone appassionate, dinamiche, aperte al cambiamento e desiderose di far parte di un grande progetto!
Per la nostra sede di Roma siamo alla ricerca di JUNIOR BUSINESS DEVELOPER da inserire nella Direzione Energy .
La risorsa nell'ambito della Struttura Operativa Energy si occuperà delle seguenti attività:
definire gli strumenti e i modelli di sviluppo per la realizzazione di impianti a fonti rinnovabili a servizio degli autoconsumi delle Società del Gruppo FSI

individuare e sviluppare, interagendo con tutte le Società del Gruppo FSI interessate, i siti e le superfici su cui realizzare gli impianti di produzione a fonti rinnovabili ovvero i correlati impianti di storage, tenuto conto dei modelli di business individuati
definire, interagendo con le altre funzioni aziendali, i parametri tecnico operativi funzionali alla definizione dei business plan dei progetti.

Sei alla ricerca di un'azienda con una solida tradizione alle spalle e lo sguardo rivolto al futuro? Vorresti far parte di uno dei più grandi gruppi industriali italiani contribuendo allo sviluppo e alla transizione sostenibile del nostro Paese?

Siamo RFI, Rete Ferroviaria Italiana S.p.A. , la società del Gruppo Ferrovie dello Stato Italiane che si occupa della gestione dell'Infrastruttura Ferroviaria Nazionale. La nostra missione è assicurare la connessione tra le diverse aree del Paese, gestendo in sicurezza ed efficienza la circolazione e le infrastrutture ferroviarie e siamo alla ricerca di persone appassionate, dinamiche, aperte al cambiamento e desiderose di far parte di un grande progetto!

Per la nostra sede di Roma siamo alla ricerca di JUNIOR BUSINESS DEVELOPER da inserire nella Direzione Energy .

ATTIVITA' DEL RUOLO

La risorsa nell'ambito della Struttura Operativa Energy si occuperà delle seguenti attività:

  • definire gli strumenti e i modelli di sviluppo per la realizzazione di impianti a fonti rinnovabili a servizio degli autoconsumi delle Società del Gruppo FSI
column2: • individuare e sviluppare, interagendo con tutte le Società del Gruppo FSI interessate, i siti e le superfici su cui realizzare gli impianti di produzione a fonti rinnovabili ovvero i correlati impianti di storage, tenuto conto dei modelli di business individuati
column3: • definire, interagendo con le altre funzioni aziendali, i parametri tecnico operativi funzionali alla definizione dei business plan dei progetti.

4029756756,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/software-engineer-for-training-ai-data-swift-at-g2i-inc-4029756756?position=10&pageNum=2&refId=ZuEMm%2BF%2FQVsgCXm6CsR1Sg%3D%3D&trackingId=sSXeaKfOOwumQq6W%2F30agg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Software Engineer for Training AI Data (Swift),G2i Inc.,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Accepted Locations

We accept applicants from the US, Canada, and most countries in LATAM and Europe. We are accepting candidates from some countries in Africa and Asia. For the complete list of accepted locations, click here. This work is 100% remote.
Our Founder/CEO, Gabe Greenberg, created a more in-depth Loom video that we highly recommend you watch! Check it out here: https://www.loom.com/share/5a8972c7fbbf46aaa3f389b2b6391c40

You’ll join an expert annotation team to create training data for the world's most advanced AI models. No previous AI experience is necessary. You'll get your foot in the door with one of the most prominent players in the AI/LLM space today. We seek software engineers with 3+ years of experience to train large AI language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. We currently have 200+ roles open!
Evaluating the quality of AI-generated code, including human-readable summaries of your rationale
Solve coding problems, writing functional and efficient code
Writing robust test cases to confirm code works efficiently and effectively

We asked the technical project manager to go into even more detail and this is how he answered: It is solving coding challenges, creating instructions to help others, reviewing the code before it goes into the model, and there's a ton of variety in the projects. We have everything from ""Which piece of Swift code is better?"" to ""Make a full mobile application using this chatbot, and improve the chatbot's responses afterward to make it faster.""
Compensation rates vary based on location and experience.
Note: The following rates are starting points and may be subject to change:
To view the complete list of locations and their values, click here.

column2: however, there is no upper limit. We have engineers working 20-40 hours per week and some working 40+ hours per week. You can work as much as you want to. You'll get paid weekly per hour of work done on the platform.

column1: Long term, there is no end date. They expect to have work for the next 2 years.
You can end the contract at any time. We hope you will commit to 12 months of work, but if you start and it's not a fit for you, we totally understand.

Developers can set their own hours—ideal candidates will be interested in spending 40 hours a week. They will be with teams, so strong performers will adapt to the urgency of projects and stay engaged, but they will also be incredibly flexible on working hours.
You can take a 3-hour lunch, no problem. Instead of tracking your hours, you are paid according to time spent on the platform, calculated in the coding exercises.
If you seem like a good fit, we'll send an async RLHF code review that will take 35 minutes and must be finished within 72 hours of us sending it.
You'll receive credentials to the RLHF platform. We'll then set up a group call to answer any further questions about onboarding with the company.

You'll perform a simulated production-level task (RLHF task) on the platform. This will be your final interview, which will ultimately determine your employment and leveling. Successful completion of this process provides you with an opportunity to work on projects as they become available.
The current priority for this team is engineers with either a Data Science background who know Swift well or software engineers who are well versed in Swift.
3+ years of experience in a software engineering/software development role.
Complete fluency in the English language.
Ability to articulate complex scientific concepts clearly and engagingly.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to maintain consistency in writing.
Solid understanding of grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines.
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science
Proficiency in working with one or more of the following: Java, JavaScript, TypeScript, C++. SQL, Swift, Ruby, Rust, Go, NET, Matlab, PHP, HTML, DART, R, Apex, and Shell, C, C#
Recognized accomplishments or contributions to the coding community or in projects.
Proven analytical skills with an ability to approach problems creatively.
Adept communication skills, especially when understanding and discussing project requirements.
A commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest coding advancements and best practices.
Enthusiasm for teaching AI models and experience with technical writing!

Accepted Locations

We accept applicants from the US, Canada, and most countries in LATAM and Europe. We are accepting candidates from some countries in Africa and Asia. For the complete list of accepted locations, click here. This work is 100% remote.

Loom Video

Our Founder/CEO, Gabe Greenberg, created a more in-depth Loom video that we highly recommend you watch! Check it out here: https://www.loom.com/share/5a8972c7fbbf46aaa3f389b2b6391c40

Overview

You’ll join an expert annotation team to create training data for the world's most advanced AI models. No previous AI experience is necessary. You'll get your foot in the door with one of the most prominent players in the AI/LLM space today. We seek software engineers with 3+ years of experience to train large AI language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. We currently have 200+ roles open!

What Will I Be Doing?

  • Evaluating the quality of AI-generated code, including human-readable summaries of your rationale
  • Solve coding problems, writing functional and efficient code
  • Writing robust test cases to confirm code works efficiently and effectively
  • We asked the technical project manager to go into even more detail and this is how he answered: It is solving coding challenges, creating instructions to help others, reviewing the code before it goes into the model, and there's a ton of variety in the projects. We have everything from ""Which piece of Swift code is better?"" to ""Make a full mobile application using this chatbot, and improve the chatbot's responses afterward to make it faster.""

Pay Rates

Compensation rates vary based on location and experience.

Note: The following rates are starting points and may be subject to change:

To view the complete list of locations and their values, click here.

  • US - 50/hr
  • Brazil - 25.40 USD /hr
  • Egypt - 14.60 USD /hr
  • Philippines - 24.20 USD /hr
  • Expectations are 15+ hours per week
column2:
however, there is no upper limit. We have engineers working 20-40 hours per week and some working 40+ hours per week. You can work as much as you want to. You'll get paid weekly per hour of work done on the platform.

Contract Length

  • Long term, there is no end date. They expect to have work for the next 2 years.
  • You can end the contract at any time. We hope you will commit to 12 months of work, but if you start and it's not a fit for you, we totally understand.

Flexible Schedules

  • Developers can set their own hours—ideal candidates will be interested in spending 40 hours a week. They will be with teams, so strong performers will adapt to the urgency of projects and stay engaged, but they will also be incredibly flexible on working hours.
  • You can take a 3-hour lunch, no problem. Instead of tracking your hours, you are paid according to time spent on the platform, calculated in the coding exercises.

Interview Process

  • Apply using this Ashby form.
  • If you seem like a good fit, we'll send an async RLHF code review that will take 35 minutes and must be finished within 72 hours of us sending it.
  • You'll receive credentials to the RLHF platform. We'll then set up a group call to answer any further questions about onboarding with the company.
  • You'll perform a simulated production-level task (RLHF task) on the platform. This will be your final interview, which will ultimately determine your employment and leveling. Successful completion of this process provides you with an opportunity to work on projects as they become available.

Tech Stack Priorities

  • The current priority for this team is engineers with either a Data Science background who know Swift well or software engineers who are well versed in Swift.

Required Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience in a software engineering/software development role.
  • Complete fluency in the English language.
  • Ability to articulate complex scientific concepts clearly and engagingly.
  • Excellent attention to detail and ability to maintain consistency in writing.
  • Solid understanding of grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines.
  • Proficiency with Swift

Nice To Haves:

  • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science
  • Proficiency in working with one or more of the following: Java, JavaScript, TypeScript, C++. SQL, Swift, Ruby, Rust, Go, NET, Matlab, PHP, HTML, DART, R, Apex, and Shell, C, C#
  • Recognized accomplishments or contributions to the coding community or in projects.
  • Proven analytical skills with an ability to approach problems creatively.
  • Adept communication skills, especially when understanding and discussing project requirements.
  • A commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest coding advancements and best practices.
  • Enthusiasm for teaching AI models and experience with technical writing!

3958049907,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/recent-graduates-in-management-engineering-informatics-stem-disciplines-at-hspi-consulenti-di-direzione-3958049907?position=3&pageNum=5&refId=QeykvyXfgXbbo6jSh2e2dg%3D%3D&trackingId=tEeZVWwSqVC8KlTqYYVMYg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,"Recent graduates in Management Engineering,informatics, STEM disciplines.",HSPI Consulenti di Direzione,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Would you like to direct your professional career towards the world of Management Consulting?
HSPI S.p.A, an IT consulting company active for over 20 years and part of the TXT Group, is the answer to your aspirations!
HSPI opens its doors to recent graduates in economics, management engineering, computer science, and scientific fields to become future IT Consultants.
HSPI offers its clients services in Business Consulting, IT Governance, and Digital Innovation.

If you have a theoretical understanding of these topics and wish to understand how they are applied in the world of work, send your application and you will have the opportunity to participate in an #Assessmentday session!

Upon successful completion of the selection process, you will have the opportunity to work with clients in the Roman territory and at the HSPI headquarters in Rome, engaging in one of the three pillars that make up HSPI and represent one of the following professional roles:
Project Management Consultant: Plans, manages, and monitors projects, ensuring the achievement of objectives within time and budget constraints.
IT Governance Consultant: Defines processes, policies, and procedures to ensure the achievement of corporate objectives through digital leverage.
Business Analyst: Analyzes business objectives and processes, identifying organizational and technological solutions for business innovation and improving corporate efficiency.
Data Scientist: Utilizes advanced data analysis techniques to extract knowledge and define strategies or make decisions.
Requirement Engineer: Explicitly negotiates and documents the requirements of IT solutions, ensuring they are clear, complete, and validated by stakeholders.
Cybersecurity Consultant: Identifies, analyzes, and mitigates risks to information security, developing and implementing strategies for data and IT service protection.
Compliance & ISO Consultant: Ensures company performance and compliance with regulations and international standards through the implementation of quality management systems.
What technical requirements should you have?
Master's degree in Management Engineering, Economics, Economics and Management, Computer Science, or STEM disciplines
Excellent knowledge of the Office package (Excel, PowerPoint, Word)
Good knowledge of the English language.
What soft skills should you possess?
Excellent communication skills (both oral and written)
Goal orientation, precision, and attention to detail.
Concrete experiences and on-the-job training: you will be immediately placed with clients of primary importance, constantly supported by Senior Consultants and Project Managers
HSPI can provide certified training in various areas, customized based on your attitudes, skills, and knowledge
Work mode with a high degree of autonomy and responsibility
Young and dynamic environment within a rapidly growing and expanding international ecosystem
Hybrid working mode with the possibility of Smart Working and flexible entry and exit times.
We anticipate an insertion with Extracurricular Internship or Apprenticeship contract, in line with your skills.
Apply and indicate in the presentation area the area of your greatest interest!
We look forward to seeing you at the next AssessmentDay!

• Goal orientation, precision, and attention to detail.

Be the transformative leader that the world needs. It’s yours to build.

In EY Consulting non troverai soltanto un lavoro, ma un’esperienza formativa che ti porterà ad essere il leader di cui abbiamo bisogno. Vogliamo essere la scintilla che dà vita alle tue ispirazioni e al tuo successo. Per questo motivo ti offriamo tutte le risorse, le competenze tecniche specifiche e le community tematiche, per sviluppare i tuoi interessi e le tue ambizioni.
Cerchiamo Transformation leader in grado di guidare trasformazioni complesse attraverso tecnologia, human e innovation, e capaci di coniugare conoscenze tecnologiche e visione del futuro.

Da subito entrerai a far parte di team e settori diversificati, partecipando attivamente ai processi di trasformazione e di innovazione di aziende, società e Pubbliche Amministrazioni per creare un impatto sul Paese.

Qual è il contesto in cui verrai inserito?

Come Senior Data Scientist farai parte della divisione AI&Data che si caratterizza per avere una forte connessione con altre aree di competenza e di supportare i clienti in programmi di trasformazione di processo, con il supporto di soluzioni innovative e integrate.
Inoltre, farai parte di una struttura consolidata, con elevata expertise, caratterizzata da un team giovane e fortemente inclusivo.
Le sedi di riferimento sono Milano, Roma, Cagliari, Bari e Trieste.
Descrizione del ruolo e delle attività
Progettazione e sviluppo di soluzioni di Machine Learning e analisi dati per i clienti
Utilizzo di strumenti e linguaggi per la manipolazione dei dati: SQL, MongoDB, Neo4j, Spark
Sviluppo di modelli predittivi tramite tecniche di Machine Learning e/o Deep Learning per NLP/NLU, Computer Vision, Time Series e analisi dei grafi di conoscenza
Gestione end-to-end di progetti analitici: dall’esigenza di business alla comunicazione efficace dei risultati di analisi
Creazione di dashboard e insight per semplificare il processo decisionale degli stakeholder
Laurea in materie ingegneristiche o scientifiche
2-4 anni di esperienza in progetti nel settore industriale, preferibilmente in società di consulenza

Conoscenza avanzata di Python e delle librerie per manipolazione dati e sviluppo modelli (pandas, tensorflow, scikit-learn, pytorch, ecc…)
Esperienza in progettazione e sviluppo di soluzioni di Machine Learning e analisi dati per i clienti

Esperienza nell'utilizzo di strumenti e linguaggi per la manipolazione dei dati: SQL, MongoDB, Neo4j, Spark, ecc. e nello sviluppo di modelli predittivi tramite tecniche di Machine Learning e/o Deep Learning
Espeirenza nella gestione end-to-end di progetti analitici: dall’esigenza di business alla comunicazione efficace dei risultati di analisi

Come Senior Data Scientist farai parte della divisione AI&
column2:
Data che si caratterizza per avere una forte connessione con altre aree di competenza e di supportare i clienti in programmi di trasformazione di processo, con il supporto di soluzioni innovative e integrate.

Inoltre, farai parte di una struttura consolidata, con elevata expertise, caratterizzata da un team giovane e fortemente inclusivo.

Descrizione del ruolo e delle attività

  • Progettazione e sviluppo di soluzioni di Machine Learning e analisi dati per i clienti

  • Conoscenza avanzata di Python e delle librerie per manipolazione dati e sviluppo modelli (pandas, tensorflow, scikit-learn, pytorch, ecc…)
  • Esperienza in progettazione e sviluppo di soluzioni di Machine Learning e analisi dati per i clienti
  • Esperienza nell'utilizzo di strumenti e linguaggi per la manipolazione dei dati: SQL, MongoDB, Neo4j, Spark, ecc. e nello sviluppo di modelli predittivi tramite tecniche di Machine Learning e/o Deep Learning
  • Espeirenza nella gestione end-to-end di progetti analitici: dall’esigenza di business alla comunicazione efficace dei risultati di analisi

4029756777,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/software-engineer-for-training-ai-data-verilog-at-g2i-inc-4029756777?position=6&pageNum=5&refId=QeykvyXfgXbbo6jSh2e2dg%3D%3D&trackingId=1iNsYeriyx04hdTBX168mg%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Software Engineer for Training AI Data (Verilog),G2i Inc.,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Accepted Locations

We accept applicants from the US, Canada, and most countries in LATAM and Europe. We are accepting candidates from some countries in Africa and Asia. For the complete list of accepted locations, click here. This work is 100% remote.
Our Founder/CEO, Gabe Greenberg, created a more in-depth Loom video that we highly recommend you watch! Check it out here: https://www.loom.com/share/5a8972c7fbbf46aaa3f389b2b6391c40

You’ll join an expert annotation team to create training data for the world's most advanced AI models. No previous AI experience is necessary. You'll get your foot in the door with one of the most prominent players in the AI/LLM space today. We seek software engineers with 3+ years of experience to train large AI language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. We currently have 200+ roles open!
Evaluating the quality of AI-generated code, including human-readable summaries of your rationale
Solve coding problems, writing functional and efficient code
Writing robust test cases to confirm code works efficiently and effectively

We asked the technical project manager to go into even more detail and this is how he answered: It is solving coding challenges, creating instructions to help others, reviewing the code before it goes into the model, and there's a ton of variety in the projects. We have everything from ""Which piece of Verilog code is better?"" to ""Make a full mobile application using this chatbot, and improve the chatbot's responses afterward to make it faster.""
Compensation rates vary based on location and experience.
Note: The following rates are starting points and may be subject to change:
To view the complete list of locations and their values, click here.

column2: however, there is no upper limit. We have engineers working 20-40 hours per week and some working 40+ hours per week. You can work as much as you want to. You'll get paid weekly per hour of work done on the platform.

column1: Long term, there is no end date. They expect to have work for the next 2 years.
You can end the contract at any time. We hope you will commit to 12 months of work, but if you start and it's not a fit for you, we totally understand.

Developers can set their own hours—ideal candidates will be interested in spending 40 hours a week. They will be with teams, so strong performers will adapt to the urgency of projects and stay engaged, but they will also be incredibly flexible on working hours.
You can take a 3-hour lunch, no problem. Instead of tracking your hours, you are paid according to time spent on the platform, calculated in the coding exercises.
If you seem like a good fit, we'll send an async RLHF code review that will take 35 minutes and must be finished within 72 hours of us sending it.
You'll receive credentials to the RLHF platform. We'll then set up a group call to answer any further questions about onboarding with the company.

You'll perform a simulated production-level task (RLHF task) on the platform. This will be your final interview, which will ultimately determine your employment and leveling. Successful completion of this process provides you with an opportunity to work on projects as they become available.
The current priority for this team is engineers with either a Data Science background who know Verilog well or software engineers who are well versed in Verilog.
3+ years of experience in a software engineering/software development role.
Complete fluency in the English language.
Ability to articulate complex scientific concepts clearly and engagingly.
Excellent attention to detail and ability to maintain consistency in writing.
Solid understanding of grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines.
Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science
Proficiency in working with one or more of the following: Java, JavaScript, TypeScript, C++. SQL, Swift, Ruby, Rust, Go, NET, Matlab, PHP, HTML, DART, R, Apex, and Shell, C, C#
Recognized accomplishments or contributions to the coding community or in projects.
Proven analytical skills with an ability to approach problems creatively.
Adept communication skills, especially when understanding and discussing project requirements.
A commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest coding advancements and best practices.
Enthusiasm for teaching AI models and experience with technical writing!

Accepted Locations

We accept applicants from the US, Canada, and most countries in LATAM and Europe. We are accepting candidates from some countries in Africa and Asia. For the complete list of accepted locations, click here. This work is 100% remote.

Loom Video

Our Founder/CEO, Gabe Greenberg, created a more in-depth Loom video that we highly recommend you watch! Check it out here: https://www.loom.com/share/5a8972c7fbbf46aaa3f389b2b6391c40

Overview

You’ll join an expert annotation team to create training data for the world's most advanced AI models. No previous AI experience is necessary. You'll get your foot in the door with one of the most prominent players in the AI/LLM space today. We seek software engineers with 3+ years of experience to train large AI language models, helping cutting-edge generative AI models write better code. Projects typically include discrete, highly variable problems that involve engaging with these models as they learn to code. We currently have 200+ roles open!

What Will I Be Doing?

  • Evaluating the quality of AI-generated code, including human-readable summaries of your rationale
  • Solve coding problems, writing functional and efficient code
  • Writing robust test cases to confirm code works efficiently and effectively
  • We asked the technical project manager to go into even more detail and this is how he answered: It is solving coding challenges, creating instructions to help others, reviewing the code before it goes into the model, and there's a ton of variety in the projects. We have everything from ""Which piece of Verilog code is better?"" to ""Make a full mobile application using this chatbot, and improve the chatbot's responses afterward to make it faster.""

Pay Rates

Compensation rates vary based on location and experience.

Note: The following rates are starting points and may be subject to change:

To view the complete list of locations and their values, click here.

  • US - 50/hr
  • Brazil - 25.40 USD /hr
  • Egypt - 14.60 USD /hr
  • Philippines - 24.20 USD /hr
  • Expectations are 15+ hours per week
column2:
however, there is no upper limit. We have engineers working 20-40 hours per week and some working 40+ hours per week. You can work as much as you want to. You'll get paid weekly per hour of work done on the platform.

Contract Length

  • Long term, there is no end date. They expect to have work for the next 2 years.
  • You can end the contract at any time. We hope you will commit to 12 months of work, but if you start and it's not a fit for you, we totally understand.

Flexible Schedules

  • Developers can set their own hours—ideal candidates will be interested in spending 40 hours a week. They will be with teams, so strong performers will adapt to the urgency of projects and stay engaged, but they will also be incredibly flexible on working hours.
  • You can take a 3-hour lunch, no problem. Instead of tracking your hours, you are paid according to time spent on the platform, calculated in the coding exercises.

Interview Process

  • Apply using this Ashby form.
  • If you seem like a good fit, we'll send an async RLHF code review that will take 35 minutes and must be finished within 72 hours of us sending it.
  • You'll receive credentials to the RLHF platform. We'll then set up a group call to answer any further questions about onboarding with the company.
  • You'll perform a simulated production-level task (RLHF task) on the platform. This will be your final interview, which will ultimately determine your employment and leveling. Successful completion of this process provides you with an opportunity to work on projects as they become available.

Tech Stack Priorities

  • The current priority for this team is engineers with either a Data Science background who know Verilog well or software engineers who are well versed in Verilog.

Required Qualifications:

  • 3+ years of experience in a software engineering/software development role.
  • Complete fluency in the English language.
  • Ability to articulate complex scientific concepts clearly and engagingly.
  • Excellent attention to detail and ability to maintain consistency in writing.
  • Solid understanding of grammar, punctuation, and style guidelines.
  • Proficiency with Verilog

Nice To Haves:

  • Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science
  • Proficiency in working with one or more of the following: Java, JavaScript, TypeScript, C++. SQL, Swift, Ruby, Rust, Go, NET, Matlab, PHP, HTML, DART, R, Apex, and Shell, C, C#
  • Recognized accomplishments or contributions to the coding community or in projects.
  • Proven analytical skills with an ability to approach problems creatively.
  • Adept communication skills, especially when understanding and discussing project requirements.
  • A commitment to continuous learning and staying updated with the latest coding advancements and best practices.
  • Enthusiasm for teaching AI models and experience with technical writing!

4011651184,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/python-and-kubernetes-software-engineer-data-ai-ml-analytics-at-canonical-4011651184?position=7&pageNum=5&refId=QeykvyXfgXbbo6jSh2e2dg%3D%3D&trackingId=6wfvJ87MTMHnIKlZFQ83QA%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,"Python and Kubernetes Software Engineer - Data, AI/ML & Analytics",Canonical,"Rome, Latium, Italy","Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing. We are hiring Python and Kubernetes Specialist Engineers focused on Data, AI/ML and Analytics Solutions to join our teams building open source solutions for public cloud and private infrastructure.

As a software engineer on the team, you'll collaborate on an end-to-end data analytics and mlops solution composed of popular, open-source, machine learning tools, such as Kubeflow, MLFlow, DVC, and Feast. You may also work on workflow, ETL, data governance and visualization tools like Apache SuperSet, dbt, and Temporal, or data warehouse solutions such as Apache Trino, or ClickHouse. Your team will own a solution from the analytics and machine learning space, and integrate with the solutions from other teams to build the world's best end-to-end data platform. These solutions may be run on servers or on the cloud, on machines or on Kubernetes, on developer desktops, or as web services.
We serve the needs of individuals and community members as much as the needs of our Global 2000 and Fortune 500 customers
column2: we make our primary work available free of charge and our Pro subscriptions are also available to individuals for personal use at no cost. Our goal is to enable more people to enjoy the benefits of open source, regardless of their circumstances.

What your day will look like
Develop your understanding of the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, and storage, to the application layer
Design, build and maintain solutions that will be deployed on public and private clouds and local workstations

Professional or academic software delivery using Python or Golang
Exceptional academic track record from both high school and university
Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long
Additional Skills That Would Be Nice To Have
The following skills may be helpful to you in the role, but we don't expect everyone to bring all of them.
Hands-on experience with machine learning libraries, or tools.

Passionate about software quality and testing

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.
Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.
Canonical is an equal opportunity employer

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

Canonical is a leading provider of open source software and operating systems to the global enterprise and technology markets. Our platform, Ubuntu, is very widely used in breakthrough enterprise initiatives such as public cloud, data science, AI, engineering innovation and IoT. Our customers include the world's leading public cloud and silicon providers, and industry leaders in many sectors. The company is a pioneer of global distributed collaboration, with 1000+ colleagues in 70+ countries and very few roles based in offices. Teams meet two to four times yearly in person, in interesting locations around the world, to align on strategy and execution.

The company is founder led, profitable and growing. We are hiring Python and Kubernetes Specialist Engineers focused on Data, AI/ML and Analytics Solutions to join our teams building open source solutions for public cloud and private infrastructure.

As a software engineer on the team, you'll collaborate on an end-to-end data analytics and mlops solution composed of popular, open-source, machine learning tools, such as Kubeflow, MLFlow, DVC, and Feast. You may also work on workflow, ETL, data governance and visualization tools like Apache SuperSet, dbt, and Temporal, or data warehouse solutions such as Apache Trino, or ClickHouse. Your team will own a solution from the analytics and machine learning space, and integrate with the solutions from other teams to build the world's best end-to-end data platform. These solutions may be run on servers or on the cloud, on machines or on Kubernetes, on developer desktops, or as web services.

We serve the needs of individuals and community members as much as the needs of our Global 2000 and Fortune 500 customers

we make our primary work available free of charge and our Pro subscriptions are also available to individuals for personal use at no cost. Our goal is to enable more people to enjoy the benefits of open source, regardless of their circumstances.

We believe in distributed collaboration but we also try to ensure that colleagues have company during their work hourse! Successful candidates will join a team where most members and your manager are broadly in the same time zone so that you have the benefits of constant collaboration and discussion.

  • Develop your understanding of the entire Linux stack, from kernel, networking, and storage, to the application layer
  • Design, build and maintain solutions that will be deployed on public and private clouds and local workstations
  • Master distributed systems concepts such as observability, identity, tracing

  • Collaborate proactively with a distributed team of engineers, designers and product managers
  • Debug issues and interact in public with upstream and Ubuntu communities
  • Generate and discuss ideas, and collaborate on finding good solutions

  • Professional or academic software delivery using Python or Golang

  • Undergraduate degree in a technical subject or a compelling narrative about your alternative chosen path
  • Confidence to respectfully speak up, exchange feedback, and share ideas without hesitation
  • Track record of going above-and-beyond expectations to achieve outstanding results
  • Passion for technology evidenced by personal projects and initiatives
  • The work ethic and confidence to shine alongside motivated colleagues
  • Professional written and spoken English with excellent presentation skills
  • Experience with Linux (Debian or Ubuntu preferred)
  • Excellent interpersonal skills, curiosity, flexibility, and accountability
  • Appreciative of diversity, polite and effective in a multi-cultural, multi-national organisation
  • Thoughtfulness and self-motivation
  • Result-oriented, with a personal drive to meet commitments
  • Ability to travel twice a year, for company events up to two weeks long

Additional Skills That Would Be Nice To Have



The following skills may be helpful to you in the role, but we don't expect everyone to bring all of them.

  • Hands-on experience with machine learning libraries, or tools.
  • Proven track record of building highly automated machine learning solutions for the cloud.
  • Experience with container technologies (Docker, LXD, Kubernetes, etc.)
  • Experience with public clouds (AWS, Azure, Google Cloud)
  • Working knowledge of cloud computing
  • Passionate about software quality and testing
  • Experience working on an open source project

What we offer colleagues

We consider geographical location, experience, and performance in shaping compensation worldwide. We revisit compensation annually (and more often for graduates and associates) to ensure we recognise outstanding performance. In addition to base pay, we offer a performance-driven annual bonus or commission. We provide all team members with additional benefits, which reflect our values and ideals. We balance our programs to meet local needs and ensure fairness globally.

  • Distributed work environment with twice-yearly team sprints in person
  • Personal learning and development budget of USD 2,000 per year

  • Recognition rewards
  • Annual holiday leave
  • Maternity and paternity leave
  • Employee Assistance Programme
  • Opportunity to travel to new locations to meet colleagues

Canonical is a pioneering tech firm at the forefront of the global move to open source. As the company that publishes Ubuntu, one of the most important open source projects and the platform for AI, IoT and the cloud, we are changing the world of software. We recruit on a global basis and set a very high standard for people joining the company. We expect excellence - in order to succeed, we need to be the best at what we do. Most colleagues at Canonical have worked from home since its inception in 2004. Working here is a step into the future, and will challenge you to think differently, work smarter, learn new skills, and raise your game.

We are proud to foster a workplace free from discrimination. Diversity of experience, perspectives, and background create a better work environment and better products. Whatever your identity, we will give your application fair consideration.

4026003468,https://it.linkedin.com/jobs/view/software-engineer-%E2%80%93-sensor-data-and-image-processing-at-e-geos-4026003468?position=8&pageNum=5&refId=QeykvyXfgXbbo6jSh2e2dg%3D%3D&trackingId=qM%2F5vtW%2Fhla4%2BZsnUc0d4g%3D%3D&trk=public_jobs_jserp-result_search-card,Software Engineer – Sensor Data and Image Processing,e-GEOS,"Rome, Latium, Italy","e-GEOS, an ASI / Telespazio company, is one of the main
international players in the field of Earth observation and geospatial information.

We are looking for a talented Software Developer to design and implement cutting-edge software solutions for processing sensor data and images from Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) and optical sensors. The ideal candidate will be involved in developing advanced algorithms and systems that leverage state-of-the-art technologies in data processing, machine learning, and computer vision to extract meaningful insights from large volumes of sensor data.
Software Development for Image Processing: Design, develop, and maintain software solutions for processing images and sensor data, with a focus on applications related to SAR and optical sensors

Algorithm Development: Create and optimize algorithms for data extraction, filtering, and enhancement of sensor images using advanced techniques such as image recognition, segmentation, and feature extraction

Machine Learning Integration: Implement machine learning models to analyze sensor data, detect patterns, and automate decision-making processes. Familiarity with frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn is a plus

Programming and Coding: Develop high-quality, efficient, and scalable software using languages such as Python and C++. Experience in leveraging Python libraries such as OpenCV for computer vision and image processing tasks is highly desirable

Data Management: Handle large datasets and optimize data pipelines for efficient processing, storage, and retrieval of sensor data in real-time environments. Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) is advantageous

Project Management and Collaboration: Manage the software development lifecycle, from initial design and development through testing, deployment, and maintenance. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the integration of sensor processing solutions with other systems
Develop and maintain software solutions for image processing related to sensor data (SAR and optical) using modern tools and framework
Write efficient code for implementing algorithms and software functionalities to support image processing and sensor data analysis
Collaborate with other developers to program solutions that enhance image processing application
Oversee development phases from concept through deployment, ensuring that project timelines and quality standards are met
Troubleshoot and debug software, ensuring robust performance and adaptability to real-world sensor data scenario
Programming skills in Python and/or C++. Experience with libraries such as GDAL SciPy, or NumPy is a plus
Hands-on experience with image processing, sensor data analysis, or similar technical field
Experience in machine learning and deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) for processing and analyzing image data
Familiarity with cloud services (AWS) and modern development practices like containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle large-scale dataset
Ability to work independently and within a team to manage multiple development stages, including planning, coding, testing, and deployment

e-GEOS, an ASI / Telespazio company, is one of the main

international players in the field of Earth observation and geospatial information.


We are looking for a talented Software Developer to design and implement cutting-edge software solutions for processing sensor data and images from Synthetic Aperture Radar (SAR) and optical sensors. The ideal candidate will be involved in developing advanced algorithms and systems that leverage state-of-the-art technologies in data processing, machine learning, and computer vision to extract meaningful insights from large volumes of sensor data.



Responsibilities

  • Software Development for Image Processing: Design, develop, and maintain software solutions for processing images and sensor data, with a focus on applications related to SAR and optical sensors
  • Algorithm Development: Create and optimize algorithms for data extraction, filtering, and enhancement of sensor images using advanced techniques such as image recognition, segmentation, and feature extraction
  • Machine Learning Integration: Implement machine learning models to analyze sensor data, detect patterns, and automate decision-making processes. Familiarity with frameworks such as TensorFlow, PyTorch, or Scikit-learn is a plus
  • Programming and Coding: Develop high-quality, efficient, and scalable software using languages such as Python and C++. Experience in leveraging Python libraries such as OpenCV for computer vision and image processing tasks is highly desirable
  • Data Management: Handle large datasets and optimize data pipelines for efficient processing, storage, and retrieval of sensor data in real-time environments. Knowledge of cloud platforms (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and containerization (Docker, Kubernetes) is advantageous
  • Project Management and Collaboration: Manage the software development lifecycle, from initial design and development through testing, deployment, and maintenance. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure the integration of sensor processing solutions with other systems


Key Activities

  • Develop and maintain software solutions for image processing related to sensor data (SAR and optical) using modern tools and framework
  • Write efficient code for implementing algorithms and software functionalities to support image processing and sensor data analysis
  • Collaborate with other developers to program solutions that enhance image processing application
  • Oversee development phases from concept through deployment, ensuring that project timelines and quality standards are met
  • Troubleshoot and debug software, ensuring robust performance and adaptability to real-world sensor data scenario


Qualifications

  • Programming skills in Python and/or C++. Experience with libraries such as GDAL SciPy, or NumPy is a plus
  • Hands-on experience with image processing, sensor data analysis, or similar technical field
  • Experience in machine learning and deep learning frameworks (e.g., TensorFlow, PyTorch) for processing and analyzing image data
  • Familiarity with cloud services (AWS) and modern development practices like containerization (Docker, Kubernetes)
  • Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to handle large-scale dataset
  • Ability to work independently and within a team to manage multiple development stages, including planning, coding, testing, and deployment

Il nostro team di Artificial Intelligence Engineering si impegna a supportare i clienti nel percorso di adozione dell’intelligenza artificiale attraverso la realizzazione di factory di soluzioni di AI, azionabili e integrate nell'architettura e nei processi aziendali.

La figura dell’AI Engineer progetta soluzioni software di Machine Learning (ML) scalabili per i casi d'uso dei clienti e le industrializza per l’esecuzione in produzione garantendo i livelli richiesti di performance, sicurezza e governabilità.

L’AI Engineer lavora a stretto contatto con altre figure di Bip xTech, come Cloud Data Architect, Data Scientist e Data Engineer, per realizzare soluzioni AI di alta qualità sotto ogni aspetto, disegnando e implementando: piattaforme MLOps, architetture dati e AI, modelli di AI, applicazioni e altro ancora.
L’AI Engineer inoltre contribuirà alla Bip xTech Data Community con attività di ricerca, scouting tecnologico, concept di nuove soluzioni e sviluppo del business sui clienti di BIP.
Sarai tu a entrare nel nostro team?
Laurea specialistica in Ingegneria Informatica, Data Science, Informatica o discipline affini (STEM).
Esperienza pregressa di almeno 5 anni nello sviluppo di software in almeno un linguaggio, come per esempio: Python, Scala, e/o simili.
Esperienza nel disegno di soluzioni software e nell’implementazione di strutture dati, algoritmi.
Esperienza nell’utilizzo degli strumenti di Code Repository e CI/CD.
Conoscenza di framework di versionamento di dati e/o modelli (esempio: MLFlow, DVC, WanDB…).
Conoscenza dei concetti, algoritmi e metodologie di Machine Learning e Gen AI.
Esperienza con linguaggi SQL per il design, query e gestione dei database
column2: esperienza nell’utilizzo di linguaggi SQL per le attività di ETL

column1: Esperienza in attività di coordinamento e crescita di un team o più team di progetto, pre-sales e delivery
Indispensabile la conoscenza fluente di italiano e inglese professionali.
Esperienza nell’utilizzo delle principali piattaforme cloud (esempio: Google, AWS, Azure) e relativi servizi di Cloud Foundation, Data Platform e AI.
Esperienza con tecniche di allenamento e fine-tuning di reti neurali (esempio: superconvergenza, PEFT, LORA…).
Conoscenza di tecniche di semi-supervised e self-supervised learning.
Esperienza con framework di lavoro AGILE (esempio: Scrum, Kanban).
Flessibilità e stress tolerance nel rispetto delle scadenze
Disponibilità di trasferte in Italia o all’estero
People at the center of our culture
Fiducia e collaborazione, imprenditorialità e coraggio, meritocrazia e sviluppo guidano la crescita delle nostre persone.
Lavorare in BIP è un'esperienza sfidante, in cui il merito paga e l'innovazione avviene attraverso idee coraggiose, collaborazione e un rapporto di fiducia con i nostri clienti.

Avrai la possibilità di metterti alla prova in contesti progettuali diversi in termini di ambito, natura delle attività e stakeholders coinvolti. Vedrai valorizzato il tuo spirito di iniziativa, la tua passione, l’autonomia e la capacità di assumerti responsabilità e metterti in gioco.
Potrai partecipare a + di 300 corsi formativi all’avanguardia per accrescere le tue competenze su tecnologie e temi di business emergenti.
Troverai una policy che supporta lo smartworking fino al 100% del proprio tempo e favorisce il work-life integration.
Valorizziamo l’unicità e ci impegniamo a garantire che tutti abbiano pari opportunità di dare un contributo ed esprimere al massimo il potenziale nell'ambiente di lavoro.

Il nostro approccio alla diversità e all’inclusione si fonda sui principi di etica e integrità e rappresenta il fattore determinante per lo sviluppo di orizzonti, di crescita personale e aziendale, più ampi.
Promuoviamo l’inserimento e l’integrazione lavorativa delle persone appartenenti alle categorie protette – in base a quanto disciplinato dalla legge 68/99 –.
Una volta ricevuto il tuo cv ci prenderemo del tempo per valutarlo attentamente.
Se c’è un match con questa o con altre posizioni aperte all’interno del Gruppo, ti contatteremo per iniziare la nostra conoscenza reciproca.
L’iter di selezione comprende generalmente un colloquio con HR, un colloquio tecnico con un line manager ed un eventuale colloquio con un Partner.
L’ordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.
In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunità future.
Se dovessi identificare ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.
Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l’esperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l’innovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5000 professionisti e professioniste, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze più all’avanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.
Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualità su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell’eccellenza, che è la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.

SENIOR AI ENGINEER

Entra nel nostro mondo.

Trasforma insieme a noi.

Quale sarà la tua sfida?

L’AI Engineer inoltre contribuirà alla Bip xTech Data Community con attività di ricerca, scouting tecnologico, concept di nuove soluzioni e sviluppo del business sui clienti di BIP.

L’ordine e il numero delle interviste potrebbero variare a seconda delle esigenze di recruiting.

In alternativa, saremo felici di conservare il tuo CV nel nostro database per poterlo rivalutare per altre opportunità future.

Se dovessi identificare ulteriori posizioni di tuo interesse ed in linea con il tuo profilo, aspettiamo la tua candidatura per poterla valutare nuovamente.

Su di Noi

Nati nel 2003, abbiamo raccolto e valorizzato l’esperienza storica della consulenza e abbiamo aggiunto due ingredienti chiave: l’innovazione e la digitalizzazione.

Grazie a questo percorso siamo oggi oltre 5000 professionisti e professioniste, presenti in 13 Paesi, con oltre 4500 progetti alle spalle e le conoscenze più all’avanguardia nell'ambito della Digital Transformation, Data Science, Cybersecurity, Industry 4.0, IOT e di tutte le Disruptive Technologies che mettiamo a servizio di ogni settore di mercato.

Aiutiamo i nostri clienti a fare la differenza creando qualità su larga scala attraverso una formula che opera su tre leve: Valore, Persone e Tecnologia.

Crediamo nel valore dell’eccellenza, che è la bussola su cui orientiamo il nostro agire, e adottiamo un approccio etico e leale nei confronti di quante e quanti scelgono di
column11: lavorare con noi, promuovendo un ambiente in cui le persone possano crescere insieme, grazie alla contaminazione tra competenze diverse.
